options: To convince the reader of a particular viewpoint
questions.answer_value: To convince the reader of a particular viewpoint

questions.question_value: Which word means 'a synonym for quick'?
What is the difference between a metaphor and a simile?
options: Metaphors directly state a comparison, while similes use 'like' or 'as'.
Metaphors are hidden comparisons, while similes are explicit.
Metaphors are used in poetry, while similes are used in prose.
questions.answer_value: Metaphors directly state a comparison, while similes use 'like' or 'as'.

options: She is as fast as a cheetah.
She runs faster than a cheetah.
questions.answer_value: She is as fast as a cheetah.

questions.question_value: What is the main function of the colon (:) in writing?
options: To separate a question from its answer

options: To create a sense of rhythm

What is the SI unit of power?
A spring with a spring constant of 100 N/m is compressed by 0.2 m. Calculate the elastic potential energy stored in the spring.
What is the formula for calculating speed?
A force of 20 N moves an object 3 meters. Calculate the work done.
A point charge of 5 μC is placed at the center of a sphere of radius 3 cm. Calculate the electric field at a point on the surface of the sphere.
A mass-spring system oscillates with a period of 2 s. Calculate the spring constant if the mass is 0.5 kg.
What is the formula for calculating momentum?
In a circuit, a resistor of 10 Ω is connected in series with a resistor of 20 Ω. What is the total resistance of the circuit?
A concave lens with a focal length of -10 cm forms an image 20 cm from the lens. Is the image real, virtual, convex or fixed?

A straight wire carries a current of 5 A. Calculate the magnetic field strength at a point 10 cm from the wire, assuming the wire is straight and the magnetic permeability of free space is \( 4\pi \times 10^{-7} \) Tm/A.
A wheel with a radius of 0.5 m rotates at 60 RPM. Calculate the linear velocity of a point on the rim of the wheel.
What is the formula for Newton's second law of motion?
The graph of pressure (P) against the reciprocal of the volume (I/V) in Boyles's law is a___?
A car starts from rest and covers a distance of 40 m in 10 s. Calculate the magnitude of its acceleration.

A coil with 500 turns and a cross-sectional area of 0.1 m² is placed in a uniform magnetic field of 0.02 T. If the angle between the magnetic field and the normal to the coil is 30°, calculate the magnetic flux through the coil.
Water flows through a pipe with a speed of 3 m/s and a cross-sectional area of 0.1 m². Calculate the volume flow rate of the water.
The amount of energy required to change a kilogram of ice block into the water without a change in temperature is?
options: specific latent heat of fusion of ice
specific heat of vaporization of ice
questions.answer_value: specific latent heat of fusion of ice

questions.question_value: A mass of 0.2 kg attached to a spring oscillates with a frequency of 5 Hz. Calculate the spring constant of the spring. (Assume no damping)

questions.answer_value: A bar magnet is placed near and lying along the axis of a solenoid connected to a galvanometer. The pointer of the galvanometer shows no deflection when?
options: the magnet is moved towards the stationary solenoid
the magnet is moved away from the stationary solenoid
the solenoid is moved away from the stationary magnet
questions.question_value: there is no relative motion
Calculate the heat required to raise the temperature of 200 g of water from 20°C to 50°C. (Specific heat capacity of water = 4.18 J/g°C)
A force of 50 N is applied to a 5 kg mass. Calculate the acceleration produced.
A light ray passes from air into water. If the angle of incidence is 45°, calculate the angle of refraction (Refractive index of water = 1.33).
A convex lens has a focal length of 10 cm. An object is placed 15 cm from the lens. Calculate the position of the image formed.
options: 30 cm on the same side as the object
30 cm on the opposite side of the object
6 cm on the same side as the object
6 cm on the opposite side of the object
questions.answer_value: 30 cm on the opposite side of the object

What is the law of reflection?
options: The angle of incidence is equal to the angle of reflection.
The speed of light is constant.
Light bends when passing through a medium.
questions.answer_value: The angle of incidence is equal to the angle of reflection.
